As a leading global animal health company, Elanco delivers innovative products and services to improve the health of pets and farm animals around the world because we believe making animals' lives better, makes life better. Since 1954, we have provided solutions that support veterinarians, farmers and pet owners to advance our vision of Food and Companionship Enriching Life. Elanco's promise to employees: Together, we foster an inclusive culture where everyone can make a difference, encouraging ownership, growth and well-being.Position Summary: The Director is a key member of the Legal, Compliance, and Corporate Affairs (LCC) function and leads Elanco’s global monitoring and reporting programs in the compliance function. The Director works with colleagues across businesses and corporate functions (including Legal, Finance, Corporate Audit Services, Tax, etc.) to develop and administer the global monitoring compliance program. Attention to detail, ability to provide strategic, sound judgment, and a team-mindset are critical to the role. Collaborative engagement, cross-functional team play and a can-do mindset are each essential. This position is also responsible for collaborating with different business units, leading program initiatives, and setting Elanco’s strategic priorities for successful monitoring and reporting programs’ compliance and execution, worldwide.The Sr. Director is an operations focused professional with compliance and privacy experience, who will:Lead in the design and implementation of the compliance and privacy monitoring framework to provide independent, risk-based monitoring of multiple compliance and privacy practice areas.Develop and deliver an annual compliance and privacy monitoring plan, ensuring all internal and external factors are taken into considerationEnsure monitoring reviews are delivered on a timely basis and to an appropriate standard of quality for both compliance and privacy needs.Create systematic queries based on the company’s policies and procedures to proactively look at high-risk areas to monitor dollar amount and volumes of transactions for data analytics use (e.g., third party interactions, integrity, meals and entertainment, employee reimbursements, etc.)Identify diagnostic outcomes and reports which indicates, trends, analytical details and possible. indications/predications of pending or trending activity.Oversee the tracking of corrective action plans which may include process updates, documentation and/or training; manage closure validation.Contribute to the enhancement of compliance and privacy processes by identifying opportunities for improved adherence to requirements and company standardsProvide guidance to support relevant stakeholders apply practical, proportionate and sustainable remediation to regulatory risk and conduct issues identified in the course of monitoring.Closely coordinate and suggest follow on action for corporate audit services and other specific functions where stakeholders may have ownership.Operate and execute the monitoring and reporting strategy, reporting to senior leadership and the Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) data, data trends, data analytics and early indicators and signals of possible issues, improvements and factors affecting such. Communicate and educate business and specific areas of outcomes, suggestions for improvement and corrective action, via the integrated resource network, or directly. Handle Code of Conduct development, planning, training and implementation, supporting CCO, on annual basis as project team lead.Support the Senior Leadership in compliance and privacy policy updates, implementation and integration and in all operational initiatives involving compliance and privacy. Assist other members of the compliance and privacy team as be needed in communications, assessments, policy updates, internal audits, education, and process improvements.
Conduct or supervise data analytics, data reporting and dashboards for monitored matters, monitoring events and in early definition of trend and analysis reporting / detection of assigned work. Manage cross-functional teams, projects and resources, directly and indirectly.Basic Qualifications: A bachelor’s degree is required. Minimum of 6 years working in compliance and privacy programs and their operational execution in a robust corporate environment with lead or deputy experience, having key responsibility for a demonstrably stable monitoring and reporting program.Minimum of 3 years handling planning, development, training and execution of an annual Code of Conduct program.Operational expertise and successful program management, leading or assisting in compliance or privacy program having globally consistent policies which are deployed via a regional/local integrated resource network effecting enhanced business decisions and privacy engagement.Prior experience building, leading and maintaining monitoring and reporting programs, embracing a principle-based approach, where matters may be accommodated and handled regionally/locally via the integrated resource network.Prior substantive direct experience with stakeholders, officials, leadership in communicating monitoring and reporting outcomes, trends, findings and corrective actions, where suggestions resulted in positive improvement to company and individual performances. Strong technical and technological understanding of data, data integrity, monitoring approaches and testing, statistical analysis, etc. Strong data and data analytics background including previous experience in data-oriented reporting, data and environment modeling, predicting and forecasting events, etc., based on specific data indicators and signals.Strong interpersonal, communication, and writing skills, with exceptional experience in risk assessment and risk management.Prior successful experience working with legal counsel, compliance staff, and business leadership to define global compliance and/or privacy requirements, successfully execute monitoring and reporting programs with data analytics or artificial intelligence, and routinely report on outcomes with improvement strategies.
Prior experience managing others directly and leading moderate to large teams successfully as a project lead is required. Self-starter requiring minimal oversight or direct management. Proven team leader and team player who values each team member, demonstrably mentors and grows team members before self, and has competently and professionally stepped in to assist members in previous projects to ensure a successful team outcome inspiring a theme of “wining as a team.” Candidate must have proven project management experience with strong judgment and analytical/problem-solving skills.Additional Skills & Preferences:Additional education within ethics and compliance, business operations with a project management focus, legal, and related fields, is highly preferred. At least three years in animal health, pharmaceutical or a medical products / related industry, preferred. CIPM and CIPT certifications are highly desiredDirect CCPA analysis and regulatory work and experience Leading product and technology teams direction and operational guidance regarding data analytics enhancements for fields of animal health, medical devices, or similar Leader of Privacy Shield certification and guided cyber-insurance placements Green Belt or higher, Six Sigma, is preferred. Prior active engagement in assisting in early business development opportunities involving digital ecosystems, encryption, cybersecurity, and anthropomorphism, is highly desired. Project Management or advanced project management Certification is desired. Prior compliance management experience is desired. Management of 3 or more direct reports is preferred. Managed internal resources, external consultants, and outside counsel to achieve resolution of privacy challenges with material impact to the divesture transaction and/or its valuation.Additional Information:Travel:Auto populated: “Do Not Enter in Job Description” field.Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.Notification of Drug testing and Background ChecksElanco conducts urinalysis drug testing as a mandatory part of its pre-employment application and background check process after acceptance of a conditional offer of employment by an applicant. Additionally, Elanco requires successful completion of a urinalysis drug test if it has reasonable suspicion that an employee is under the influence of drugs or alcohol which adversely affects or could adversely affect the employee's job performance as allowed by applicable law. Tested applicants will be given a copy of any positive test result. All test results shall be considered confidential and shall not be disclosed by Elanco, other than to those persons for whom such disclosure is necessary. Positive test results, or a refusal to consent to and participate in pre-employment drug testing, shall be grounds for denial of employment. Cooperation in scheduling the testing is important for processing an application for employment.
